line_1: When hears'd in death the woe-worn Genius sleeps,
line_2: Then o'er his grave a grateful country weeps,

line_1: If no black guilty Thoughts disturb my Sleeps,
line_2: If Virtue my free Soul unsully'd keeps,

line_1: Sometimes awhile the hoary Tyrant sleeps,
line_2: Hid in his cave beneath the watery deeps;

line_1: All the bright gladsome Hours he sullen Sleeps,
line_2: Battens on Sands, or hides in slimy Heaps;

line_1: Where hid from Cold the wily Serpent sleeps,
line_2: So when the Stag breaths on the guilty Heaps,

line_1: Since Frederic now for ever sleeps,
line_2: Art droops again, and Science weeps;

line_1: A friend, a wife, a mother sleeps:
line_2: Lo! where this silent marble weeps,

line_1: Thus the lorn traveller imprudent sleeps
line_2: Thus o'er his limbs resistless torpor creeps,

line_1: See murder'd Mary calmly sleeps,
line_2: And, blissful change! no longer weeps.

line_1: O'er the turf where Oscar sleeps;
line_2: See Malvina bends, and weeps

line_1: "Beneath the fern the moorcock sleeps,
line_2: Back to his rock the night-bird creeps,

line_1: And fast beside him, once-fear'd Edward sleeps:
line_2: Here o'er the Martyr-King the Marble weeps,

line_1: Into his straw, and till the morning sleeps.
line_2: Then, free from care, and free from thought, he creeps

line_1: Nor favour'd, nor disgrac'd, there ESSEX sleeps,
line_2: Nor SOMERSET his Master's Sorrows weeps,

line_1: How regular his meals, how sound he sleeps!
line_2: What early philosophic hours he keeps,

line_1: Queen of the coral groves, ZOSTERA sleeps;
line_2: Stretch'd on her mossy couch, in trackless deeps,

line_1: For CATO now with ROSCIUS sleeps!
line_2: The Muse his honour'd memory weeps,

line_1: Neglects to Feed, and rarely Sleeps;
line_2: Far from his Flock Alexis weeps,

line_1: Alas! that Fury never sleeps,
line_2: But thro' the World still slily creeps,

line_1: In which by Day the weary'd Badger sleeps.
line_2: With hollow vaulted Cells, and rising Heaps

line_1: Lo! at the couch where infant beauty sleeps,
line_2: Her silent watch the mournful mother keeps;

line_1: O're Publius Bosome while He sleeps,
line_2: Ne're harms the Bed, but lightly creeps

line_1: And the soft Zephyr on its Bosom sleeps.
line_2: But slowly down its flow'ry Borders creeps,
